info.name: Hypoglossal nerve
info.description: The twelfth or hypoglossal cranial nerve is purely motor and innervates the ipsilateral intrinsic and extrinsic skeletal muscles of the tongue (except for the palatoglossus). It exits the medulla as a series of rootlets in the ventral lateral or anterolateral fissure between the olive and the pyramid in the medulla.
